alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 5:50AM PDT until August 02 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY... At 550 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Upwards of 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in some areas. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Alamo, US Highway 93 between mile markers 23 and 44, Pahranagat West Road, Box Canyon Road, Repeater Road, and Badger Road. Alamo, US Highway 93 between mile markers 23 and 44, Pahranagat West Road, Box Canyon Road, Repeater Road, and Badger Road. The Badger Spring Valley sensor has recorded 2.87 inches of precipitation in the past 3 hours. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
